dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Elon Musk is suing Walmart over those coal-powered generators.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Elon Musk is suing Walmart over those coal-powered generators.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Walmart claims that Tesla installed faulty solar panels that eventually spontaneously combusted and caught fire at seven Walmart stores around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, the ones that were installed at, like, thousands of their stores?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, the ones that were installed at, like, thousands of their stores?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Walmart claims that Tesla installed faulty solar panels that eventually spontaneously combusted and caught fire at seven Walmart stores around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he's claiming that anti-coal activists actually sabotaged them, causing all those fires.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he's claiming that anti-coal activists actually sabotaged them, causing all those fires.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walmart says in the lawsuit it believes the failures were the result of rushed installation because Teslas solar division adopted an ill-considered business model that required it to install solar panel systems haphazardly and as quickly as possible in order to turn a profit, and the contractors and subcontractors who performed the original installation work had not been properly hired, trained, and supervised.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the lawsuit says Walmart inspectors were extremely diligent, right? They checked every single one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the lawsuit says Walmart inspectors were extremely diligent, right? They checked every single one.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The lawsuit alleges that Tesla inspectors didnt notice defects that were visible to the naked eye, used cable connectors that werent compatible with one another and failed to see that loose and hanging wires were present at multiple sites.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So it's not an installation issue, according to him. It's deliberate tampering.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. So it's not an installation issue, according to him. It's deliberate tampering.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Walmart says in the lawsuit it believes the failures were the result of rushed installation because Teslas solar division adopted an ill-considered business model that required it to install solar panel systems haphazardly and as quickly as possible in order to turn a profit...

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But hang on—weren't these generators supplied by a Tesla company? I thought Tesla was all about electric.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But hang on-weren't these generators supplied by a Tesla company? I thought Tesla was all about electric.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elon Musk Walmart claims that Tesla installed faulty solar panels that eventually spontaneously combusted and caught fire at seven Walmart stores around the country.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's the weird part. Tesla's denying any connection to coal generators now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's the weird part. Tesla's denying any connection to coal generators now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But didn't Tesla acquire a coal conglomerate back in 2020? That feels like a pretty big detail to leave out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But didn't Tesla acquire a coal conglomerate back in twenty twenty? That feels like a pretty big detail to leave out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla got into the solar business after it acquired SolarCity in 2016 for $2.6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And now they're expanding the lawsuit to include all generator locations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And now they're expanding the lawsuit to include all generator locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So Musk thinks environmental radicals are trying to undermine what he calls clean energy—which in this case is coal?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Musk thinks environmental radicals are trying to undermine what he calls clean energy-which in this case is coal?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently. He says it's to tarnish his reputation and his plans to revolutionize traditional energy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently. He says it's to tarnish his reputation and his plans to revolutionize traditional energy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just… wow. And meanwhile, Walmart's CEO just announced new subsidies for traditional energy users this week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just... wow. And meanwhile, Walmart's C E O just announced new subsidies for traditional energy users this week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Just this week, CEO Elon Musk announced a revamped pricing plan in an effort to boost the slowing business. The new pricing model allows residents in six states to rent solar power systems starting at $50 a month ($65 a month in California) instead of buying them up front.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: The timing is definitely something. You almost can't make this up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The timing is definitely something. You almost can't make this up.

artist_script:
HostA: Elon Musk is suing Walmart over those coal-powered generators.
HostB: Wait, the ones that were installed at, like, thousands of their stores?
HostA: Yeah, and he’s claiming that anti-coal activists actually sabotaged them, causing all those fires.
HostB: But the lawsuit says Walmart inspectors were extremely diligent, right? They checked every single one.
HostA: Exactly. So it’s not an installation issue, according to him. It’s deliberate tampering.
HostB: But hang on—weren’t these generators supplied by a Tesla company? I thought Tesla was all about electric.
HostA: Yeah, that’s the weird part. Tesla’s denying any connection to coal generators now.
HostB: But didn’t Tesla acquire a coal conglomerate back in 2020? That feels like a pretty big detail to leave out.
HostA: Right? And now they’re expanding the lawsuit to include all generator locations.
HostB: So Musk thinks environmental radicals are trying to undermine what he calls clean energy—which in this case is coal?
HostA: Apparently. He says it’s to tarnish his reputation and his plans to revolutionize traditional energy.
HostB: Which is just… wow. And meanwhile, Walmart’s CEO just announced new subsidies for traditional energy users this week.
HostA: The timing is definitely something. You almost can’t make this up.
